tourName: Mekong River cruise to Angkor Wat, Cambodia
placesVisited: Phnom Penh, Kampong, Chanang, Tonlé Sap, Siem Reap
generalInfo: What better way to experience the lush countryside, slow pace and friendly welcome of Cambodia and Vietnam than floating down the mighty Mekong River? We’ll take you on an 8 day cruise from Saigon to Siem Reap (or vice versa), home to the world-famous ruined temples of Angkor, recreating the great journeys of the past aboard a colonial style, 20-passenger river boat. Along the way you will visit riverside farming communities, a remote Buddhist pagoda and a floating village, immersing yourself in the watery way of life along this great river.

dayInfo.description: After settling into your cabin, explore Saigon’s Chinatown, Giac Lam Pagoda, the Flower Market and Binh Tay market. Enjoy a delicious welcome dinner and cocktail to get your journey started! Optional: night time food adventure by vintage Vespa (L/D)

Another day to explore Saigon's historic sights on foot and sample the famous local coffee scene. After lunch on board, pay a visit to the War Museum to learn about Cambodia's recent turbulent history, Overnight on board. (B/L/D)

First stop is My Tho, a quiet, prosperous city famous for its many fruit orchards, gardens and huge rice fields and a great introduction to the beauty of the delta. Continue to Cai Be, where you take a small boat along the canals to see handicrafts being produced using traditional methods. In the afternoon it's time for an easy kayak adventure suitable for first-time paddlers, before sailing on to Sa Dec for the night. (B/L/D)

Short tour of Sa Dec, a small town of 30,000 people fascinating in its unspoiled authenticity and largely undisturbed by tourists. Cruise for most of the day to Chau Doc, which has developed around fish farming. (B/L/D)

Explore a reforested wetland and take a cable car to a mountain-top viewpoint and temple for vistas across a mosaic of glistening rice paddies. Then cruise to the immigration check point at Vinh Xuong and on to Phnom Penh in the late evening. (B/L/D)

Full day city sightseeing tour including the Royal Palace, Silver Pagoda, National Museum, Central Market and Wat Phnom. In the evening you will be entertained by a local group performing a traditional Apsara dance show. (B/L/D)

This morning cruise on to the Kampong Tralach with its beautiful vihara (Buddhist monastery) set amongst the lush countryside. Transfer by van to Udong, Cambodia’s former capital, for a taste of Buddhist meditation and historic temples. Anchor for tonight a few miles upstream at the gateway of Tonlé Sap lake. (B/L/D)

Arrive at Kampong Chhnang, one of the largest fishing ports on the Tonlé Sap and famous for its pottery and sugar palm products. Enjoy a tasting of regional products and if you have energy left you can cycle along the riverside to a pottery village. Enjoy a farewell dinner tonight with the crew. (B/L/D)
After breakfast, complete the journey overland by van to Siem Reap, home of the majestic Angkor Wat. We can arrange extension tours of Cambodia and Vietnam on request. (B)
